name: Initial state set on system startup / reset
Initial state set on system startup / reset
Assign Chapter Number
Trigger video overlay on game display, then clear again
Assign appropriate action based on new chapter entered
This flow illustrates how to create events triggered at certain points in a game timeline
This example subdivides time into four chapters, based on the game timer
A different video is triggered on the in-game display as the game enters each chapter
Get current time
(Optional) Do something with the page returned

        flex: 0 0 auto !important;

</style>
info:

 - Theme: Style -> Dark

name: Modo Kiosko
Recuperar y formatear el tiempo de juego global
Get Global Time Remaining
Enviar para mostrar en la URL especificada
Asignar archivo de video (debe ubicarse en la carpeta /.node-red/uibuilder/sitename/src)
Pantalla del juego: muestra el tiempo restante, un video/imagen de fondo y cualquier mensaje enviado desde el panel.
Requiere el nodo node-red-contrib-uibuilder, que se puede instalar desde el Administrador de paletas
Actualizar elemento del generador de interfaz de usuario
Los archivos multimedia que se insertan dinámicamente en la página (por ejemplo, videos o imágenes activados) deben colocarse en la carpeta /.node-red/uibuilder/sitename/src
CONFIGURACIÓN\n Edite el nodo ui-builder <display> para especificar una URL en la que se publicará la pantalla\n Luego, haga clic en la pestaña Archivos y pegue el contenido de la siguiente manera:
index.html (haga doble clic para ver)

name: README
info:
This flow contains all the required to interface a device to Node-RED.

To setup a new device.

i.) Create a copy of this flow 
    - Ctrl+A to select all the nodes
    - Ctrl+C to copy them
    - Click the + icon to add a new flow
    - Ctrl+V to paste nodes into the new flow

ii.) Edit the "Configuration" node at the top left
 - Edit the JSON string of the flow.payload. It must contain the unique "id" of this prop, and that must match the one defined on the prop controller.
    {
        "id": "Switches-1",
        "name": "Toggle Switches",
        "description": "Players must scan the switches",
        "state": "UNSOLVED"
    }

iii.) There are _many_ possible methods by which a device can communicate with Node-RED.
This flow contains several alternatives - MQTT, UDP, Serial, TCP, WebSockets, HTTP - only _one_ needs to be activated, the others should be disabled or removed from the flow.
If possible, the initial configuration is performed automatically based on values supplied in the "Configuration" node. 
When the device with the specified device id first connects, the ip address and port from which it is sent will be stored and used for all future messages sent back to the device.
If using Serial connection, you will need to select the COM port to which the device is attached, as this is not auto-detected.

iii.) In the "Dashboard controls" group, edit the HTML in the Dashboard Panel node to create the desired graphical representation of the state of this device

iv.) Also edit the group in which the "SOLVE" and "RESET" buttons are placed.
